en: Do you want to help me?
Do you want to kiss me?
I want to buy them all.
I want to cook for you.
I want to go into town.
I want to go right now.
I want to go to Boston.
I want to speak to Tom.
I want to wait for Tom.
I want Tom to like you.
I want Tom to see this.
I want you out of here.
I want you to be quiet.
I want you to call Tom.
I want you to find Tom.
I want you to go there.
I didn't want you to know.
Tom doesn't want me to go.
ko: 톰은 내가 가는 걸 원하지 않아.

en: Do you want to make a deal?
Do you want to hold my hand?
I'd like to pick you up now.
We just want to talk to Tom.
Why do you want to meet Tom?
Do you want to say something?
What is it you want to ask me?
I want to hear what Tom thinks.
Tom doesn't want Mary to leave.
What do you want for Christmas?
Is there anywhere you want to go?
Do you want to talk to me or not?
I want to go to bed early tonight.
I want you to return to your seat.
I don't want to ruin Tom's holiday.
Is that what you really want to do?
ko: 그게 네가 진짜 하고 싶은 거야?

en: Is there something you want to say?
Tom wants to call off the marriage.
Do you want to learn to play guitar?
I don't want Tom to know about this.
Tom wants to buy a present for Mary.
ko: 톰이 메리한테 줄 선물을 사고 싶어 해.

en: Are you sure you don't want anything?
I want you to take this medicine now.
Tom didn't want Mary to go to Boston.
ko: 톰은 메리가 보스턴에 가는 걸 원하지 않았어.

en: He wants to marry my daughter.
ko: 걔가 내 딸이랑 결혼하고 싶어 해.

en: Most English words are unknown to most English speakers.
ko: 대부분의 영어 화자들은 대부분의 영어 단어를 몰라.

en: Do you want to go out with me tonight?
I don't want to go to school tomorrow.
I have a message I want you to deliver.
Tom wanted his son to live in the city.
Come here. I want to show you something.
ko: 이리 와 봐. 보여줄 게 있어.

en: I watched a Swedish movie last night.
I have lost interest in studying, so I don't think there is any point in going to college.
ko: 공부에 흥미를 잃어서 대학 가는 게 의미 없는 것 같아.

en: Practice is tough. But, if it is for the sake of victory, then you must be able to endure.
ko: 연습은 힘들지만, 우승을 위해서라면 견뎌야 해.

en: Because the Japanese morning train is very crowded, I would be out of breath if I caught the express train at 8 in the morning.
ko: 일본 아침 기차는 너무 붐벼서, 아침 8시 급행을 타면 숨이 막힐 지경이야.

en: Since losing the match was everyone's fault, you don't have to apologize.
ko: 경기에서 진 건 모두의 잘못이니까 사과할 필요 없어.

en: I pray for your happiness from the bottom of my heart.
I really appreciate that you think of me that way.
ko: 날 그렇게 생각해 줘서 정말 고마워.

en: Are you sure you don't want me to talk to Tom?
ko: 진짜 내가 톰이랑 얘기 안 해도 괜찮겠어?

en: You don't have to answer if you don't want to.
ko: 하기 싫으면 대답 안 해도 돼.

en: The last thing I'd ever want to do is hurt Tom.
ko: 톰에게 상처 주는 일은 정말 하고 싶지 않아.

en: If they don't want this, then what do they want?
ko: 이걸 원하는 게 아니면, 대체 뭘 원하는 거야?

en: I can't speak German at all.
I want to meet with Tom.
I want to know who killed Tom.
I want you to tell me everything you know about Tom.
ko: 네가 아는 톰에 대한 모든 걸 말해줘.

en: One and a half years have passed since I started to learn Chinese.
ko: 중국어 배우기 시작한 지 일 년 반 지났어.

en: My computer sometimes shuts down suddenly.
Mercury is the planet nearest to the sun.
I've had a slight sore throat since this morning. I wonder if I've caught a cold.
ko: 아침부터 목이 좀 따끔거리는데 감기 걸렸나 봐.

en: I've had a scratchy throat since this morning. I wonder if I've caught a cold.
ko: 아침부터 목이 칼칼한데 감기 걸린 건가?

en: That was being sold at a dollar store.
It was also sold at a 100 yen store.
It would've been nice if you'd helped me a little.
Where was it? I've forgotten it.
Tanaka has been arrested on suspicion of murder.
If you don't eat fast, you will be late for school.
If you don't eat fast, you'll be late for school.
ko: 빨리 안 먹으면 학교 늦을 거야.

en: Tom locked his sister in the closet.
Is there something that you want to tell me?
I just want to say how thankful I am for all your help.
If you want me to wear those boots, I'll wear those boots.
I want to live in Boston.
I don't want to waste your time.
I would be happy to do so.
I'm glad I make you happy.
I'm happy to be here, Tom.
I'm so happy for you both.
I'm so happy for you guys.
I'm so happy for you, Tom.
I'm so happy you like Tom.
I'm happy to hear you say that.
Tom is definitely not happy to be there.
ko: 톰은 거기 있는 게 전혀 행복하지 않아 보여.

en: Tom tried to pick his keys up with his toes.
Tom got jealous when he saw Mary talking to a handsome guy.
ko: 톰은 메리가 잘생긴 남자랑 얘기하는 걸 보고 질투했어.

en: Tom is rather busy at the moment.
It looks like you've been busy today.
Tom is busy making breakfast for the family.
Medical innovations are the best way to relieve us from sufferings.
ko: 의학의 혁신은 우리가 고통에서 벗어나는 최고의 방법이야.

en: Just be careful not to push Tom too hard.
There were three hundred cardboard boxes filled with old clothes ready to be sent to the disaster area.
ko: 재난 지역으로 보낼 헌 옷이 가득 담긴 종이 상자가 300개나 있었어.

en: I know that I'm in trouble now.
ko: 나 지금 큰일 난 거 알아.

en: Tom used to bake cookies for us.
Why don't you go play outside?
How long have you been playing the violin?
The big fish eat the small ones.
I recently met an old friend.
ko: 나 얼마 전에 옛날 친구 만났어.

en: I sensed immediately that something was wrong.
I would like to be alone.
Tom should've discussed it with his parents.
I don't think that Tom is selfish.
ko: 난 톰이 이기적이라고 생각 안 해.

en: The exam was two and a half hours long.
ko: 시험은 두 시간 반 동안 봤어.

en: On the main menu of this DVD there is no 'Play Main Feature' button.
ko: 이 DVD 메인 메뉴에는 '본편 재생' 버튼이 없어.

en: I learned a lot from Tom.
Where did you buy the flowers?
I've always wanted to learn how to skate.
I borrowed three books from the library.
I'm so tired that I can barely move.
I've got something in my eye.
After talking to Tom for a few minutes, it became obvious that his French wasn't very good, so Mary switched to English.
ko: 톰이랑 몇 분 얘기해 보니까 프랑스어를 잘 못하는 게 빤히 보여서, 메리는 영어로 바꿔서 말했어.

en: Do you want to give it a try?
Tom's planning something special for Mary's birthday.
ko: 톰이 메리 생일에 뭔가 특별한 걸 계획하고 있어.
톰은 뭔가 잘못됐다는 걸 알고 있어.

en: This is something I have to do.
Did I miss something this morning?
ko: 오늘 아침에 내가 뭐 놓친 거 있어?

en: I don't need gold, I only seek the ultimate truth.
ko: 난 황금은 필요 없어, 오직 궁극의 진리만을 찾을 뿐이야.

en: A lot of people attended Tom's funeral.
Tom sat down on the sofa.
I thought that you'd agree with me.
ko: 네가 내 말에 동의할 줄 알았어.

en: If I had all the time in the world, I'd build a boat and sail to Fiji.
ko: 시간이 아주 많다면 배를 만들어서 피지까지 항해할 텐데.

en: Some things are better not said.
ko: 말하지 않는 게 나은 것들도 있어.

en: And he saith unto them, Why are ye fearful, O ye of little faith? Then he arose, and rebuked the winds and the sea; and there was a great calm.
ko: 그가 '믿음이 적은 자들아, 왜 무서워하느냐?'라고 말씀하시고는 일어나서 바람과 바다를 꾸짖으셨고, 그러자 아주 잔잔해졌어.

en: "I'll do it tomorrow." "You said that yesterday!"
I need a keyboard to be funny.
You should have kept your mouth shut.
I should have kept my mouth shut.
My uncle gave me this watch.
I went swimming in the river.

ko: 걔네 가족이 나 정말 좋아해 줬어.

en: After taking a shower, Tom ate dinner.
She has remained in her present position for ten years.
Let's not talk about it anymore.
His car is two years old.
I thought that you were from Boston.
ko: 난 네가 보스턴 출신인 줄 알았어.

en: The star system Alpha Centauri has a planet called Alpha Centauri Bb.
ko: 알파 센타우리 성계에는 알파 센타우리 Bb라고 불리는 행성이 있어.

en: I want to be a teacher.
Tom looked around, but saw no one.
Tom looked around, but didn't see anyone.
ko: 톰은 주위를 둘러봤지만 아무도 못 봤어.

en: The bus stopped, but no one got out.
I appreciate what you did yesterday.
Do you know anybody in Boston?
I know him better than anybody.
Go away, I want to be alone!
ko: 저리 가, 나 혼자 있고 싶어!

en: I don't think he is right.
ko: 걔 말이 맞는 것 같지 않아.

en: I like that dress a lot.
ko: 나 저 드레스 진짜 마음에 들어.

en: Tell Tom that I said hi.
It all started with a well-intentioned experiment.
ko: 다 좋은 의도로 시작한 실험에서 비롯된 거야.

en: Tom said that he'd call at 2:30.
I thought that you'd gone to Boston.
Never write the words "bortsch" and "shchi" in German!
Luck is a part of life.
I'm looking for my passport. Have you seen it?
What time is it over there?
If you have the time you are welcome to make use of and contribute to the Tatoeba project.
ko: 시간 있으면 타토에바 프로젝트를 이용하거나 기여해 봐.

en: I took it as a joke and did not answer.
ko: 농담인 줄 알고 대답 안 했어.

en: What do you think was the most read article this year on the Japanese version of Wikipedia?
ko: 일본어 위키백과에서 올해 제일 많이 읽힌 문서가 뭐라고 생각해?

en: I thought that a game of tennis might be fun.
ko: 테니스 한 판 치면 재밌을 것 같았어.

en: I have more experience than Tom.
I thought that you said you used to live in Boston.
I thought that you said that you used to live in Boston.
ko: 너 보스턴 살았었다고 말한 줄 알았어.

en: I thought you said that you used to live in Boston.
ko: 너 보스턴 살았었다고 했던 것 같은데.

en: I thought that you might want to look over these documents.
ko: 네가 이 서류들을 좀 보고 싶어 할 것 같아서.

en: I wish I could have eaten at that restaurant with you.
ko: 너랑 그 식당에서 같이 먹었으면 좋았을 텐데.

en: I lost my adorable kitten a few weeks back.
ko: 몇 주 전에 귀여운 아기 고양이를 잃어버렸어.

en: He that will steal an egg will steal an ox.
The cutting machine sliced the salmon.
I'm still angry because of her.
I plan to give my son a computer at the end of the month.
ko: 이번 달 말에 아들한테 컴퓨터를 사 줄 계획이야.

en: If one has the right to live, then one should also have the right to die. If not, then living is not a right, but an obligation.
ko: 살 권리가 있다면 죽을 권리도 있어야 해. 그렇지 않으면 삶은 권리가 아니라 의무니까.

en: The church is in the middle of the village.
I ended up seeing it under bad circumstances.
ko: 안 좋은 상황에서 그걸 보게 됐어.

en: The play is based on true events.
ko: 그 연극은 실화를 바탕으로 하고 있어.

en: The queue for the toilet has got too long. Do you think it's time we expedited things by having a peek?
ko: 화장실 줄이 너무 길어졌어. 슬쩍 들여다보고 좀 빨리 해결해야 할 것 같지 않아?

en: With the toilet queue getting too long, do you think we'll make it back in time for the curtain?
ko: 화장실 줄이 너무 긴데, 공연 시작 전까지 돌아올 수 있을까?

en: My level of Japanese is weak, so I can't write well.
ko: 일본어 실력이 부족해서 잘 못 써.

en: The Chinese government took measures to slow the rise of the price of houses.
ko: 중국 정부가 집값 상승을 억제하려고 조치를 취했어.

en: They held themselves in high regard.
I became embarrassed about the matter.
Tom had never been to Boston.
ko: 탐은 보스턴에 가본 적이 한 번도 없었어.

en: If anything happens, call me right away.
That tired boy is sound asleep.
The sales floor was relatively uncrowded.
Soccer is a sport in which players can't touch the ball with their arms, except for the keeper, who can use his whole body to defend the goal.
ko: 축구는 골키퍼가 골대를 지키려고 온몸을 쓰는 걸 제외하고는 선수들이 팔로 공을 건드리면 안 되는 스포츠야.

en: There's really nothing much at all that you see as being beneath you.
ko: 너한테 하찮은 일은 정말 아무것도 없구나.

en: Where's the gate for Japan Airlines flight 124?
He that thinks little, errs much.
ko: 생각을 적게 하면 실수가 많은 법이야.

en: The first was not the best.
ko: 첫 번째 게 제일 나은 건 아니었어.

en: Are you in a bad mood?
I spoke to Tom last night.
I thought that I recognized Tom.
Thou preparest a table before me in the presence of mine enemies; Thou hast anointed my head with oil; my cup runneth over.
ko: 주님이 내 원수들 앞에서 내게 상을 차려 주시고 내 머리에 기름을 부으시니 내 잔이 넘쳐.

en: I've just gone and lost my key somewhere around here.
ko: 이 근처 어디선가 방금 열쇠를 잃어버렸어.

en: I thought that I'd never be happy again.
I thought that this might come in handy.
ko: 이게 요긴하게 쓰일 수도 있겠다 싶었어.

en: "I will talk with Mary as soon as possible.", Tom thought to himself.
ko: "최대한 빨리 메리랑 얘기해야지"라고 톰은 속으로 생각했어.

en: In case of an emergency, what number should I call?
Since I speak the truth, I live soundly at home.
ko: 난 진실만 말하니까 집에서도 맘 편히 지내.

en: Adding manpower to a late software project makes it later.
ko: 지연되는 소프트웨어 프로젝트에 인력을 추가하면 더 늦어질 뿐이야.

en: It is OK for me to use that?
Is it OK if I use that?
When you have allergies, eating at a restaurant is a huge pain.
ko: 알레르기가 있으면 식당에서 밥 먹는 게 진짜 고역이야.

en: When you have food allergies, eating out is difficult, isn't it?
ko: 음식 알레르기 있으면 외식하기 힘들지, 그치?

en: In America, cars drive on the right side of the road.
For the love of money is the root of all evil: which while some coveted after, they have erred from the faith, and pierced themselves through with many sorrows.
ko: 돈을 사랑하는 게 모든 악의 뿌리래. 어떤 사람들은 돈을 탐내다가 믿음을 저버리고 결국 큰 고통을 겪게 된 거지.

en: Someone stole my car. It's not there where I parked it.
ko: 누가 내 차를 훔쳐갔어. 주차해둔 곳에 없어.

en: I wonder what it would be like to feel refined and elegant like him.
ko: 그 사람처럼 세련되고 품위 있으면 어떤 기분일까 궁금해.

en: Do you really want to move to Boston again?
ko: 너 진짜 다시 보스턴으로 이사 가고 싶어?

en: Do you really want to move back to Boston?
ko: 너 진짜 보스턴으로 다시 돌아가고 싶어?

en: Do you accept a credit card?
If you'd stuck around, you would've had a lot of fun.
ko: 네가 계속 있었으면 진짜 재밌었을 텐데.

en: How much time do adults spend watching television every day?
ko: 어른들은 매일 TV 보는 데 시간을 얼마나 써?

en: He is especially frightened of dogs.
Get out of here, all of you!
If you want to grow up, you have to drink a lot of milk.
ko: 키 크고 싶으면 우유 많이 마셔야 돼.

en: Could you push the door open?
He's a cold person like that.
ko: 걔 원래 좀 그렇게 차가운 사람이야.

en: I thought that I saw something.
I thought that I smelled bacon.
The door hinge's creaking is annoying!
ko: 문 경첩 끼익거리는 소리 진짜 거슬려!

en: Who is being exchanged with whom?
I don't like dirty jokes, but I get a kick out of it when you tell them.
ko: 나 야한 농담 싫어하는데, 네가 하면 되게 웃기더라.

en: Have you been crying all night? Your eyes are all puffy.
About how much money do you need?
I don't think this is interesting.
I don't think that this is interesting.
I'm sorry that I got you in trouble.
You should watch that movie sometime; it's very interesting.
ko: 그 영화 언제 한번 봐봐, 되게 재밌어.

en: She is looking at our fruit.
That person is looking at our fruit.
ko: 저 사람이 우리 과일 보고 있어.

en: I'm not in that much of a hurry.
Read this sentence three times, and while you are sleeping, a ghost will manifest.
ko: 이 문장 세 번 읽어봐, 그럼 잘 때 귀신 나타날걸.

en: The French and the English like drinking, but the latter prefer beer whereas the former go in for red wine.
ko: 프랑스랑 영국 사람들은 술 좋아하는데, 영국 사람들은 맥주를 더 좋아하고 프랑스 사람들은 레드 와인을 더 좋아해.

en: Out of those three people, Mike is the biggest.
ko: 저 세 명 중에서 마이크가 제일 커.

en: Christmas comes but once a year.
ko: 크리스마스는 일 년에 딱 한 번뿐이야.

en: Why don't you take off your coat?
Aren't you going to take your coat off?
My elder brother plays the guitar very well.
ko: 우리 형 기타 진짜 잘 쳐.

en: The whale was found off the coast of Wakayama.
More women than men commit perjury.
ko: 남자보다 여자가 위증을 더 많이 해.

en: Do you still love your wife?
This is one of the dictionaries I told you about yesterday.
ko: 이게 내가 어제 말했던 그 사전 중 하나야.

en: Tom gave Mary his telephone number.
You are such a nice person! You are so kind to me! Thank you.
ko: 너 진짜 좋은 사람이다! 나한테 너무 잘해줘서 고마워.

en: If you have a time, could you translate some sentences below, please?
ko: 시간 있으면 밑에 문장들 좀 번역해 줄래?

en: I don't play tennis after school.
He forgot to feed the dog.
ko: 걔 강아지 밥 주는 거 까먹었어.

en: This river is two hundred kilometers long.
Why do you drink until you're this drunk?
Why do you drink until you are that drunk?
Could you tell me your name again?
I think it would be more fun to go together.
ko: 같이 가는 게 더 재밌을 것 같아.

en: I thought that Tom would be in Boston by now.
ko: 톰이 지금쯤 보스턴에 있을 줄 알았어.

en: I would not go so far as to call Finland a paradise.
Now that you are in Italy, you must see Naples.
ko: 이탈리아에 왔으니까 나폴리는 꼭 봐야 해.

en: His heart sank to his boots.
How are you going to Milan?
He wants me to go with him to Milan by train to visit a friend.
ko: 걔가 친구 만나러 기차 타고 밀라노에 같이 가재.

en: I spent a week in Florence last year. I'm sure you'll like it.
ko: 작년에 피렌체에서 일주일 있었는데, 너도 분명 좋아할 거야.

en: I'll come back for my suitcases this afternoon.
ko: 오늘 오후에 내 가방 찾으러 다시 올게.

en: Tom is the only person who could've stolen Mary's necklace.
ko: 메리 목걸이를 훔쳤을 만한 사람은 톰밖에 없어.

en: The book is on the table.
Tom and Mary have two cats.
ko: 톰이랑 메리는 고양이 두 마리 키워.

en: I caught a big fish yesterday with my bare hands.
ko: 나 어제 맨손으로 큰 물고기 잡았어.

en: Someone like you can change the world.
ko: 너 같은 사람이 세상을 바꿀 수 있어.

en: How far apart are the contractions?
You have a healthy baby boy.
You've given birth to a healthy baby boy.
They just had a healthy baby boy.
What time will the train arrive in Yokohama?
Can you explain the exact meaning of this word?
ko: 이 단어의 정확한 뜻을 설명해 줄 수 있어?

en: Don't fix it if it ain't broke.
If it's not broken, don't fix it.
Tom showed Mary several pictures of his house.
ko: 톰이 메리한테 자기 집 사진 몇 장 보여줬어.

en: Tom tried to leave, but Mary stopped him.
Walking to work in this heat isn't a good idea.
ko: 이 더위에 걸어서 출근하는 건 좋은 생각이 아니야.
난 고대 언어 배우는 게 좋아.

en: Our father, you see; he's a person who only thinks about work all the time.
ko: 우리 아빠는 말이야, 일밖에 모르는 사람이야.

en: Lasagna is one of my favorite foods.
ko: 라자냐는 내가 제일 좋아하는 음식 중 하나야.

en: I'm feeling a little under the weather today.
ko: 나 오늘 몸이 좀 안 좋아.

en: The police searched Tom Smith's house.
Tom Smith's home got searched by the police.
As for my father, he has not gone abroad until now.
ko: 우리 아빠는 지금까지 해외에 한 번도 안 가보셨어.

en: "I have the wrong life," was his last words.
ko: "난 인생을 잘못 살았어"라는 게 그가 남긴 마지막 말이었어.

en: The only thing you have to do is shut your mouth.
ko: 넌 그냥 입만 다물고 있으면 돼.

en: I don't like the house he is living in.
There are some books that you are looking for that may be found.
ko: 네가 찾는 책들 몇 권은 찾을 수도 있을 거야.

en: I have not seen such beautiful flowers.
Sorry, I can't stay for long.
The last days of January happened to be cold.
Is there a lot of flowers in this garden?
That ceremony is scheduled to be no longer than 30 minutes.
I want to be an astronaut.
I thought Tom was a Canadian.
ko: 난 톰이 캐나다 사람인 줄 알았어.

en: Why did you go to the city?
I have heard of this song some time ago.
ko: 이 노래 예전에 들어본 적 있어.

en: He is expected to go abroad next year.
I will not speak French with you again.
ko: 너랑 다신 프랑스어로 말 안 할 거야.

en: There's a dictionary on top of the desk.
A diamond that hasn't been cut does't shine.
I am looking for someone to learn English together.
ko: 나 영어 같이 공부할 사람 찾고 있어.

en: If you want we can use English.
It doesn't matter who, just ask somebody.
I'm happy when I'm with you.
Don't ask me such difficult questions.
The word you use depends on your intended meaning.
ko: 어떤 뜻으로 말하느냐에 따라 쓰는 단어가 달라.

en: He speaks French and of course he speaks English, too.
ko: 걔는 불어도 할 줄 알고, 당연히 영어도 할 줄 알아.

en: He's too young to live by himself yet.
ko: 걔는 아직 혼자 살기엔 너무 어려.

en: Did you leave the door open last night?
No matter what you say, I'll do it my way.
ko: 네가 뭐라 하든 난 내 방식대로 할 거야.

en: What time is it there now?
That house is small, but it's big enough for us.
ko: 그 집은 작지만 우리한테는 충분히 커.

en: That's more recent than you think it is.
It's only when I have things I have to do that I find I want to do things I don't have to do.
ko: 꼭 해야 할 일이 있을 때만 안 해도 되는 일들이 하고 싶어지더라.

en: "You're really clumsy!" "Get out of my face. I already know that."
I thank you sincerely for having shown me the errors.
I will properly carry out the things that I said myself.
ko: 내가 한 말은 내가 제대로 책임지고 할게.

en: When was the last time you went to an art gallery?
He will probably never walk again.
ko: 걔는 아마 다시는 못 걸을 거야.

en: So long as men believe that women will forgive anything, they will do anything.
ko: 남자들이 여자가 다 용서해 줄 거라고 믿는 이상, 무슨 짓이든 할 거야.

en: I'm going to give you just one more chance.
ko: 딱 한 번만 더 기회를 줄게.

en: I'm going to give you one last chance.
ko: 마지막으로 기회를 한 번 더 줄게.

en: I'll give you just one more chance.
ko: 딱 한 번만 더 기회 줄게.

en: I'll give you one last chance.
It seems that my son is now at a rebellious age and recklessly opposes us.
ko: 우리 아들이 사춘기인지 우리한테 막무가내로 반항하네.

en: You left the computer on, but is that okay?
Why don't you tell me about it?
It is delightful to be praised by an expert in the field.
I wonder why I feel so lonely when it gets cold.
I still believe the Internet is not a place for children.
ko: 난 여전히 인터넷이 애들이 있을 곳은 아니라고 생각해.

en: Don't make fun of me when I'm talking seriously.
My parents don't want me to get married.
ko: 우리 부모님은 나 결혼하는 거 안 원하셔.

en: Can I have your phone number?
He often goes to Japan on business.
My wife is obsessed with cleaning.
He has bought a banana case.
She showed absolutely no sign of remorse.
There is no rest for the poor.
Shall we go to drink coffee or something?
I think I'll email my friends.
I send a letter to my mother.
I'll send my mother a letter.
I'll send a letter to my mother.
Do you mind if I lay down on the sofa?
Do you want to say anything?
Many people believe that acupuncture can cure diseases.
ko: 침으로 병을 고칠 수 있다고 믿는 사람이 많아.

en: How much is that wooden chair?
I love her sister very much.
Your pussy stinks when you have sex with me, because you are a dirty slut.
ko: 나랑 섹스할 때 너 밑에서 냄새나, 더러운 년이라서.

en: She has an important role in our organization.
ko: 걔는 우리 조직에서 중요한 역할을 하고 있어.

en: Is your child a boy or a girl?
Tom opened the window to let in some fresh air.
ko: 톰은 환기 좀 시키려고 창문을 열었어.

en: This isn't my responsibility. It's yours.
ko: 이건 내 책임이 아니야. 네 책임이지.

en: She doesn't know what she really wants.
ko: 걔는 자기가 진짜 뭘 원하는지 몰라.
난 혼자 밥 먹는 거 싫어해.
난 절대 혼자 술 안 마셔.
톰, 너 혼자 있으면 안 돼.

en: I hate being alone this time of year.
ko: 난 일 년 중 이맘때쯤 혼자 있는 게 정말 싫어.

en: Tom was sitting alone in the dark waiting for Mary.
ko: 톰은 메리를 기다리며 어둠 속에 혼자 앉아 있었어.

en: From the tower you can look out across the plain spread beneath your eyes.
ko: 탑에서는 눈앞에 펼쳐진 평원을 내려다볼 수 있어.

en: Why don't you come inside and wait?
I wonder why it's always Tom and Mary who show up in Tatoeba sentences.
ko: 왜 타토에바 예문에는 맨날 톰이랑 메리만 나오는지 궁금해.

en: I wonder why the names Tom and Mary are often used in sentences that are in the Tatoeba Corpus.
ko: 왜 타토에바 코퍼스 문장들에는 톰이랑 메리라는 이름이 자주 쓰이는지 궁금해.

en: Today's math class was more interesting than usual.
ko: 오늘 수학 수업은 평소보다 더 재미있었어.

en: Why don't you take your coat off?
What does he want you to call him?

ko: 나 그거 한 기억이 안 나.

en: Did you forget to bring money?
It's not that far from here.
Does this look good on me?
I hear you have a new girlfriend.
Would you please take a picture?
Could you please take a picture?
I slipped on my geta and dashed outside.
Please put your shoes in the getabako when you take them off.
Please put your shoes in the shoebox when you take them off.
What will I do? The strap on one of my geta has come undone.
What will I do? The strap on one of my geta is broken.
Tokyo is one of the largest cities in the world.
ko: 도쿄는 세계에서 가장 큰 도시 중 하나야.

en: Happiness and sadness only last for a time.
What do you want to do tomorrow?
She confessed her love to him.
If dinner isn't ready by seven, I'm going to a restaurant.
ko: 7시까지 저녁 준비 안 되면 식당 가서 먹을 거야.

en: Well, if dinner isn't ready by seven, I'm going to a restaurant.
ko: 음, 7시까지 저녁 준비 안 되면 식당 가서 먹을 거야.

en: Hey, if dinner isn't ready by seven, I'm going to a restaurant.
ko: 야, 7시까지 저녁 준비 안 되면 나 식당 갈 거야.

en: Organic matter is formed by large molecules.
That ticket is good until April 29th.
How long did you stay in Boston?
How long do you plan to stay in Boston?
He has little money, but he gets by.
ko: 걔 돈은 별로 없는데 그럭저럭 살아.

en: He has hardly any money, but he gets by.
ko: 걔 돈이 거의 없는데 그래도 먹고는 살아.

en: He has almost no money, but he gets by.
ko: 걔 돈이 거의 없는데도 잘 지내.

en: Franz Liszt created the concept of the "symphonic poem". This is a composition for orchestra that uses music to describe nonmusical content. This could include, for example, people, legendary figures, landscapes, or paintings.
ko: 프란츠 리스트는 '교향시'라는 개념을 만들었어. 이건 음악을 사용해서 비음악적인 내용을 묘사하는 관현악곡이야. 예를 들면 인물, 전설적인 인물, 풍경, 아니면 그림 같은 게 포함될 수 있어.

en: The best-known compositions by Franz Liszt are his nineteen Hungarian Rhapsodies, but he also created beautiful sonatas, symphonies, concerti, songs, and religious compositions.
ko: 프란츠 리스트의 작품 중 가장 잘 알려진 건 19개의 헝가리 광시곡이지만, 그는 아름다운 소나타, 교향곡, 협주곡, 가곡, 그리고 종교 음악들도 만들었어.

en: The best-known compositions by Franz Liszt are his nineteen Hungarian Rhapsodies, but he also created beautiful sonatas, symphonies, concerti, Lieder, and religious compositions.
ko: 프란츠 리스트의 작품 중 가장 잘 알려진 건 19개의 헝가리 광시곡이지만, 그는 아름다운 소나타, 교향곡, 협주곡, 리트, 그리고 종교 음악들도 만들었어.

en: I agreed to take on the job realizing that I had no choice.
ko: 선택의 여지가 없다는 걸 알고 그 일을 맡기로 했어.

en: "Is this really a natural expression?" "Let's ask Mr. Google."
The sentence got longer after it was re-written.
Let's go to the flea market tomorrow.
The teacher and I sat down face to face.
